name: Hotel Puerta de Sevilla

reviews.title: Hotel Puerta de Sevilla - Style and value !
reviews.text: Our ten-day stay confirmed the Hotel's excellent reviews. We can only add our pleasant surprise at the extremely convenient location, offering all facilities, including The Barber, within easy strolling-distance, and our gratitude to the courteous and efficient English-Speaking Management and Staff for their splendid service and generous assistance.

This hotel is in an excellent location, within walking distance to main attractions and bus stops. I agree that it is on a main road and so you do receive the traffic noises and late night noise from the restaurants downstairs but we were not too disturbed by the noise, we must have been too exhausted!
reviews.title: Great location but rooms are small

reviews.text: However the room is very small, we had a triple room, but the room was the same size as a double with two single beds and a roll away bed pushed together. There was hardly any room to walk around or put our luggage. The bathroom was also very small but had two sinks and a standing shower.
reviews.title: Your door to Seville

likes.liked: — The staff, the value for money and the air-conditioning

reviews.text: The service at the front desk was very friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: The one-star rating for this hotel is unfair. I guess it's because it doesn't have breakfast facilities but across the corner is the El 3 de Oro where locals stop to have their breakfast on their way to work.
reviews.title: The one-star rating is accurate
What a find!
reviews.text: We were 2 couples travelling in Andalusia and found that this hotel is excellently situated within walking distance from the main sights of the hotel and travelling in July we were glad to find air-conditioning in our room (outside was a fiery 43C). The rooms are not big but adequate and clean and we found no problems with the size of the bathroom. The staff was attentive, kind and helpful especially the night shift guy and the lady who had the evening shift who helped us find and book for us a flamenco show at the eleventh hour! I find it hard to beat such value for money for 65 Euros per night and I have stayed in bad hotels and paid much more.
I have used Trip Advisor many times to research hotels before holidays. Last week, we spent two nights in Sevilla, and I had high hopes for this hotel.
reviews.title: Not what we expected
Some Good, Some Bad
reviews.text: It's in an unbeatable position, right on the edge of the Barrio Santa Cruz. That is about the only good thing.
Our room was very small, and the bathroom so small that if someone was on the loo, the other couldn't access the shower. The room was very basic - shampoo and shower gel in tiny satchets.
reviews.title: Bit disappointing

reviews.text: Service was not great either. My husband put some laundry in on Saturday evening, and was told that it would be ready the following day. The guy on reception then said that it wouldn't be back 'til Monday. We were checking out on Monday morning. It was presented back to us on Monday when we checked out, unwashed and had been forgotten.
reviews.title: Calm down, it's not such great value...

reviews.text: The staff turned off the airconditioning during the day also, which meant that we returned to a hot room. Not great.
reviews.title: Best hotel in Sevilla, hands down...

description: Cozy family hotel in the historic center of Seville "Barrio de Santa Cruz", next to the city's top attractions: Cathedral, Giralda, Real Alcazar, Casa de Pilatos, etc. By the only parking available in 1 km around. Seville-style rooms with a/c, heating, satellite TV (channels in: English, French, German, etc), free wifi internet in all rooms, safe, ironing board, telephone.Friendly and multilingual staff (English, French, Italian, etc). Terrace with views of the Giralda and Murillo Gardens.
